FermentableBase.description: FermentableBase provides unique properties to identify individual records of fermentable ingredients.

FermentableType.description: FermentableType collects the attributes of a fermentable ingredient to store as record information.

alpha_amylase.description: Where diastatic power gives the total amount of all enzymes, alpha amylase, also known as dextrinizing units, refers to only the total amount of alpa amylase in the malted grain. A value of 25-50 is desirable for base malt.

diastatic_power.description: Diastatic power is a measurement of malted grains enzymatic content. A value of 35 Lintner is needed to self convert, while a value of 100 or more is desirable.

protein.description: The percentage of protein. Higher values may indicate a possibility of haze, or lautering issues.

kolbach_index.description: The Kolbach Index, also known as soluble to total ratio of nitrogen or protein, is used to indcate the degree of malt modification. A value above 35% is desired for simple single infusion mashing, undermodified malt may require multiple step mashes or decoction.

max_in_batch.description: The recommended maximum percentage to use in a grain bill.

recommend_mash.description: True if the fermentable must be mashed, false if it can be steeped.

FermentableAdditionType.description: FermentableAdditionType collects the attributes of each fermentable ingredient for use in a recipe fermentable bill.

timing.description: The timing object fully describes the timing of an addition with options for basis on time, gravity, or pH at any process step.

YieldType.description: The potential yield of the fermentable ingredient, supporting SG, or percentage. eg 1.037 or 80% are valid yield types.

fine_grind.description: Percentage yield compared to succrose of a fine grind. eg 80%

coarse_grind.description: Percentage yield compared to succrose of a coarse grind. eg 78%

fine_coarse_difference.description: The difference between fine and coarse grind, a difference more than 2 percent can indicate a protein or step mash may be desirable. eg 2%.

potential.description: The potential yield of the fermentable ingredient for 1 lb of grain mashed in 1 gallon of water. eg 1.037
